content.p: Let {{function_symbol}}(x) = {{poly}}. Explain and demonstrate how to find an equation for the line tangent to the graph of {{function_symbol}}(x) at the point ({{pointx}}, {{pointy}}).

outtro.p: The equation of the tangent line is y = {{tanline}}.

content.p: A {{widget}} is sold for \${{price}} per item. Suppose that the number of items produced is equal to the number of items sold and that the cost (in dollars) of producing x {{widget}}s is given by the following function: C(x)={{cost_function}}.
Explain and demonstrate how to find the marginal revenue, the marginal cost, and the marginal profit in this situation.

outtro.p: The marginal cost is {{marginal_cost}}, the marginal revenue is {{price}}, and the marginal profit is {{marginal_profit}}.
